text.text_translated:
Small animals like birds, squirrels, mice, and insects live in many cities and towns. People see these animals more and more now. In some cities, bigger wild animals come in larger numbers. For example, people saw bears in Vancouver parks. Leopards came into the streets of Mumbai. Wild pigs were in gardens in Berlin. 

What do people do when big animals come to cities? Do they like these animals or not? Some people think they are dangerous or pests.

The press, like newspapers and TV, often make reports about this. They tell stories about wild animals in cities.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Small animals like birds, squirrels, mice, and insects live in many cities and towns. People see them often. In some cities, many wild animals come inside. Wild animals live in nature, not in houses.

For example, people saw bears in the parks of Vancouver. In Mumbai, leopards came into the streets. In Berlin, wild pigs were in gardens.

What do people do when big animals come to cities? Do they like these animals? Or do they think the animals are dangerous or pests?

The press is newspapers and TV channels. They make reports. Reports are stories about what happens.  
A pest is an animal or insect that people do not want because it can cause problems.
